attributes.action: Returning Jihadists  must be returned, to stand trial in Islamic Courts
attributes.additional_details:
it must be remembered that these people  took part in, or enabled -  at the point of a gun:- Murder, rape, theft, religious suppression,  and genocide. When they set out upon their course action they must have been aware of their fate if they were caught and they had factored that  in as a risk worth taking.

The purpose of the United Kingdom Human Rights Act is not to protect people from the consequences of their own actions
attributes.background: There is  some confusion legally as to how,  returning Jihadists should be treated. Does the Government agree that  jihadists must not be able  to claim under Human Rights legislation, an  immunity from prosecution, abroad, because they would not get a fair trial.
